result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J. Kuntz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges (include the DNA surcharge)

6/27/16 - Court approves Atty. Fees in the amount of $4,081.02.  Pursue to standing order, that amount is due within 60 days or on a pay plan approved by the Clerk of Court's Office.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 82 days jail consecutive with Huber.   If the failure to pay sanction if imposed, the Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.

--No acts/threats of violence to any person
--Comply with all treatment recommendations and follow through as required by treating providers and agent
--No possession of any dangerous weapons or any ammunition
--Any other asessment, treatment or counseling per agent
--No contact with MSS, unless authorized by existing juvenile/family courts orders and agent

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 2:08 pm [sf]
Defendant Lucas J. Kuntz in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis written by Defendant and Attorney Humes read by Attorney Humes; Court and Attorney Humes discuss intention. Attorney Humes recites what part of the factual statement shows intent; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--No acts/threats of violence to any person
--Comply with all treatment recommendations and follow through as required by treating providers and agent
--No possession of any dangerous weapons or any ammunition
--Any other asessment, treatment or counseling per agent
--No contact with MSS, unless authorized by existing juvenile/family courts orders and agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges (include the DNA surcharge)

Court orders that the Defendant check into the Jefferson Probation Office today after court.

Days credit for time already served: 78 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:3 pm
to adjourn plea/sent date granted - New bond to be endorsed on or before 12-18-2015
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-07-2016 01:30 pm

Court's response to clerk's note: Yes Please attempt to have def. sign new bond form at 12/2/15 Hearing.

modifying the non-monetary conditions of bond

Case called at 2:11 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Lucas J. Kuntz in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes: Awaiting some further negotiations after Mr. Kuntz started anger management counseling, are jointly requesting an additional DA PTC and STC, after 10/23/15, which will likely be plea/setencing as ADA Teuber I understand will be out of the office until 10/23/15. 
DA Happ: Agreed
Court reminds Mr. Kuntz that his bond remains in effect
Recess: 2:15 pm

Case called at 1:05pm [mo]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Lucas J. Kuntz in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Humes indicates that Atty. Humes and the prosecutor have had negotiations that include assessments prior to sentencing; requests STC in mid September
--no objection from ADA Teuber

The Court addresses Mr. Kuntz's missed payments for attorney fees
--Atty. Humes indicates that Mr. Kuntz has child support payments also, further that Mr. Kuntz can make payment with next paycheck

The Court does not take action at this time and refers the matter to the Branch IV Judge.

Case called at 8:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Lucas J. Kuntz in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Kuntz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

case called at 2:25pm. 
Defendant Lucas J. Kuntz in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Humes indicates that she had a recent Pretrial Conference with th assigned prosecutor and a settlement proposal was given.

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.

Case called at 1:33 pm
Defendant Lucas J. Kuntz in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney De La Rosa advises that he appears for bond purposes only.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with MSS 
-No presence at school, residence or any place temporarily occupied by MSS

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:37 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC:4/22/15 at 9:40 am
Status: 5/1/15 at 2:00 pm
